traer.physics
Class TwoBodyForce.ForcePair

java.lang.Object
  traer.physics.TwoBodyForce.ForcePair
Enclosing class:
TwoBodyForce
protected static class TwoBodyForce.ForcePair
extends java.lang.Object

This class wraps Vector3D forces to apply to the two ends of this TwoBodyForce.

For the especially memory conscious, the ForcePair fields can be manipulated directly; use the updateBoth(Vector3D, Vector3D) or updateEqualAndOpposite(Vector3D) or use the getters and manipulate the Vector3Ds directly.

Author:
Carl Pearson

Field Summary
private  boolean equalAndOpposite
          Whether or not a ForcePair is equal and opposite; set permanently at instantiation
private  Vector3D forceOnOneEnd
          The Vector3D representation of the force on the oneEnd Particle.
private  Vector3D forceOnTheOtherEnd
          The Vector3D representation of the force on the otherEnd Particle.
 
Constructor Summary
private TwoBodyForce.ForcePair(Vector3D forceOnOneEnd)
          Constructor for the equal-and-opposite case.
private TwoBodyForce.ForcePair(Vector3D forceOnOneEnd, Vector3D forceOnTheOtherEnd)
          Constructor for the not equal-and-opposite case.
 
Method Summary

          Gets the force on oneEnd.

protected  TwoBodyForce.ForcePair updateBoth(Vector3D forceOnOneEnd, Vector3D forceOnTheOtherEnd)
          Updates the force for both ends according to the parameters.
protected  TwoBodyForce.ForcePair updateEqualAndOpposite(Vector3D forceOnOneEnd)
          Sets the force on oneEnd according to forceOnOneEnd argument, and the force on theOtherEnd as equal and opposite.

Field Detail

forceOnOneEnd

private Vector3D forceOnOneEnd
The Vector3D representation of the force on the oneEnd Particle.

forceOnTheOtherEnd

private Vector3D forceOnTheOtherEnd
The Vector3D representation of the force on the otherEnd Particle. This is null in the case of ForcePair created as equal and opposite.

equalAndOpposite

private final boolean equalAndOpposite
Whether or not a ForcePair is equal and opposite; set permanently at instantiation

Parameters:
forceOnOneEnd - the force on the oneEnd particle; cannot be null
forceOnTheOtherEnd - the force on the otherEnd particle; cannot be null

forceOnTheOtherEnd

protected Vector3D forceOnTheOtherEnd()
Gets the force on theOtherEnd. Changing this Vector3D will not mutate the forceOnOneEnd, even in the equal-and-opposite case.

Returns:
the force on theOtherEnd

protected TwoBodyForce.ForcePair updateEqualAndOpposite(Vector3D forceOnOneEnd)
                                                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
Sets the force on oneEnd according to forceOnOneEnd argument, and the force on theOtherEnd as equal and opposite.
